required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Intracranial Thrombus Aspiration Catheter in the Treatment of Acute Large-vessel Occlusive Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multi-center, Single-arm Objective Performance Criteria Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Intracranial Thrombus Aspiration Catheter in Treatment of Acute Large-vessel Occlusive Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, multicenter, single-arm objective performance criteria trial to investigate the safety and efficacy of SINOMED ADPAT for Recanalization Therapy in acute large-vessel occlusive stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: This study plans to recruit 164 patients with acute intracranial large-vessel occlusion within 24 hours time window. The Primary endpoint is the instant recanalization rate of target vessel after operation. Secondary efficacy endpionts will include: 1) immediate recanalization rate of the first pass of aspiration; 2) the recanalization time of the target vessel blood flow; 3) the improvement of the postoperative NIHSS score; 4) the ratio of good neurological function (mRS 0-2 points) at 90 days; 5) the success rate of device; 6) the success rate of operation; 7) The proportion of rescue therapy. Safety endpionts will include: 1) the incidence of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 24 hours after operation; 2) all-cause death and stroke-related mortality at 90 days; 3) stroke recurrence rate within 90 days after operation; 4) surgery-related complications; 5) adverse events; 6) serious adverse events; 7) Device defection rate

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, multicenter, single-arm objective performance criteria

primary_outcome.measure: Instant recanalization rate of target vessel after operation
primary_outcome.description: Instant recanalization rate (mTICI 2b-3) of target vessel after operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Instant recanalization rate of target vessel after the first aspiration
secondary_outcome.description: Instant recanalization rate (mTICI 2b-3) of target vessel after the first aspiration

secondary_outcome.measure: The recanalization time of the target vessel blood flow
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Procedure time (femoral artery puncture to recanalization)
secondary_outcome.description: The recanalization (mTICI 2b-3) time of the target vessel blood flow

secondary_outcome.measure: The improvement of the postoperative NIHSS score the improvement of the postoperative NIHSS score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in NIHSS score at preoperative、24(-6/+24) hours、7±2 days or discharge
secondary_outcome.description: NIH Stroke Scale/Score (NIHSS)：Calculates the NIH Stroke Scale for quantifying stroke severity.
The modified Rankin Scale/Score (mRS) : scores of 0 to 2 were defined as good neurological function (treatment success)

The intracranial thrombus aspiration catheter was successfully delivered to the occluded segment of the blood vessel and then successfully released, and suction was performed, and the delivery system was successfully withdrawn.
The success of recanalization after the final treatment (mTICI 2b-3, allowing the use of rescue therapy)

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage
secondary_outcome.description: Through Heidelberg Bleeding Classification to evaluate the intracranial hemorrhage (National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score of ≥4 points)
The existence of clear imaging evidence to confirm that the target vessel is occluded again, which leads to an ischemic stroke event.
Procedure-related complications: including arterial rupture, arterial dissection, distal thromboembolism, vascular puncture site complications, etc

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events and serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Any adverse events and serious adverse events are associated with clinical trials in human

arm_group.description: Intracranial Thrombosis Aspiration Catheter, product of Sinomed Neurovita（Device Name: SINOMED ADPAT）

overall_official.affiliation: The Second Affiliated Hospital of Army Medical University
